channel.title: Running on linux
channel.description:
Whats the proper batch file to running on linux?
mines like set PATH=/rscd/apache-ant-1.7.0/bin set JAVA_HOME=/root/java/javak1.4.2_18/ ant demonikp2p ; demonikp2p ; demonikp2p ; demonikp2p
dosn't seem to work.. I am running centos 5 if that helps...
can somebody point me in the general direction so I can't find the answer..

item.title: Running on linux
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

[quote=“freaky5000, post:2, topic:221594”]My vps is running on centos 5, i have a runme file in my server folder which runes my server and also a log_server file. This is what’s in my runme file.

export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/apache-ant-1.7.0/bin:/usr/local/jdk1.6.0_06/bin;
export JAVA_HOME="/usr/local/jdk1.6.0_06"
export ANT_HOME="/usr/local/apache-ant-1.7.0"
ant compile
ant demonikp2p > log_server 2>&1 &[/quote]

I will try this…

What are the specs of your vps and how many people are you able to host?

Read full topic

item.title: Running on linux
item.dc:creator: @Vrunk Vrunk
item.description:
@Vrunk wrote:

if you have trouble with not being able to open a socket, add this to the command line arguments

-Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true

since Java6 uses IPv6 by default

Read full topic

item.title: Running on linux
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

My vps is running on centos 5, i have a runme file in my server folder which runes my server and also a log_server file. This is what’s in my runme file.

export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/apache-ant-1.7.0/bin:/usr/local/jdk1.6.0_06/bin;
export JAVA_HOME="/usr/local/jdk1.6.0_06"
export ANT_HOME="/usr/local/apache-ant-1.7.0"
ant compile
ant demonikp2p > log_server 2>&1 &
